title: Geth Sepolia sync always ~100 blocks behind
body:
Hi,

I'm running a geth node (v1.10.25, Sepolia testnet) along with prysm. When I check sync status on the geth console, it always seems to be 100 blocks behind. It has been running for 36+ hours now. 

Geth console logs for the most part have looked like this (constantly adding/removing peers, peerCount in the range of 6-8):

![Screenshot 2023-02-06 154800](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19509342/217460342-e0e32290-a1b8-48a7-843d-c5e46269de7d.png)

Sync status:

![Screenshot 2023-02-06 143250](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19509342/217460851-719babc7-2a8d-4dab-ae56-3df90ec59219.png)

Start command:
```./geth --sepolia --config /home/user/Desktop/CoinClients/ethereum/execution/geth/config/config.toml --metrics --metrics.expensive --metrics.addr 0.0.0.0 --metrics.port 8000 --override.terminaltotaldifficulty 17000000000000000 --verbosity 4 >> /home/user/Desktop/CoinData/ethereum/geth/logs/geth.log 2>&1```

Please let me know if there are any other pieces of information that I should provide to help diagnose the issue.
Thanks.
Why are you running with override.terminaltotaldifficulty?
Would be nice to run without debug logs, just the normal ones, this is too verbose and we have nothing of value among the noise.

Hey @karalabe , these are the logs with a lower verbosity level (3):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19509342/217583094-778f7c07-b436-41c0-aed3-cb13fb119218.png)


> --override.terminaltotaldifficulty 17000000000000000

I set the TTD for Sepolia based on this: https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/06/30/sepolia-merge-announcement
Not sure if there's a default.

Geth has been running for almost a week now and the issue is still there. Any ideas?

Not sure if this will give any indications as to what the problem is, but for context these are the first 1K log lines: https://gist.github.com/onejmi/50bd7d8dc99bbb7455ecc57d493a344e

Thanks

It's a bit strange, looks as if you didn't have peers capable of serving snap data. Could you print out `admin.peers`? Also perhaps update to 1.10.26 (though I don't think it will magically fix your stuck sync).
Thanks for that , but what a shame FSReid

Thankyou for you're help

On Wed, 15 Feb 2023, 00:34 Omar Elnajmi, ***@***.***> wrote:

> It's a bit strange, looks as if you didn't have peers capable of serving
> snap data. Could you print out admin.peers? Also perhaps update to
> 1.10.26 (though I don't think it will magically fix your stuck sync).
>

Hi @karalabe ,

To my knowledge, I'm not using a modified version of Geth (Installed geth from here: https://geth.ethereum.org/downloads)

I'm running geth as follows:

```
./geth --sepolia --config /home/user/client/geth/config/config.toml --metrics --metrics.expensive --metrics.addr 0.0.0.0 --metrics.port 8000 --override.terminaltotaldifficulty 17000000000000000 --verbosity 4 >> /home/user/data/geth/logs/geth.log 2>&1
```
This is my `config.toml` file:
```
[Eth]
NetworkId = 11155111
SyncMode = "snap"
EthDiscoveryURLs = ["enrtree://AKA3AM6LPBYEUDMVNU3BSVQJ5AD45Y7YPOHJLEF6W26QOE4VTUDPE@all.sepolia.ethdisco.net"]

NoPruning = false
NoPrefetch = false
LightPeers = 200
UltraLightFraction = 75
DatabaseCache = 4096
TrieCleanCache = 1024
TrieCleanCacheJournal = "triecache"
TrieCleanCacheRejournal = 3600000000000
TrieDirtyCache = 1024
TrieTimeout = 3600000000000
Preimages = true
SnapshotCache = 0
EnablePreimageRecording = false
RPCGasCap = 25000000
RPCTxFeeCap = 1e+00

[Eth.Ethash]
CachesInMem = 4
CachesOnDisk = 6
CachesLockMmap = false

DatasetsInMem = 2
DatasetsOnDisk = 4
DatasetsLockMmap = false
PowMode = 0

[Eth.TxPool]

GlobalQueue = 2048

[Eth.GPO]

[Node]

HTTPHost = "0.0.0.0"

HTTPModules = ["admin", "engine", "debug", "personal", "txpool", "net", "web3", "eth"]

WSPort = 8888
WSOrigins = ["*"]
WSModules = ["admin", "engine", "debug", "personal", "txpool", "net", "web3", "eth"]
AllowUnprotectedTxs = true
JWTSecret = "/home/user/client/consensus/prysm/jwt.hex"

[Node.P2P]

"enr:-Ku4QEWzdnVtXc2Q0ZVigfCGggOVB2Vc1ZCPEc6j21NIFLODSJbvNaef1g4PxhPwl_3kax86YPheFUSLXPRs98vvYsoBh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpC1MD8qAAAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhDZBrP2Jc2VjcDI1NmsxoQM6jr8Rb1ktLEsVcKAPa08wCsKUmvoQ8khiOl_SLozf9IN1ZHCCIyg"]

Adding more details related to the geth executable:

```
$ ./geth version
Geth
Version: 1.10.26-stable
Git Commit: e5eb32acee19cc9fca6a03b10283b7484246b15a
Git Commit Date: 20221103
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.18.5
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=go
```

@onejmi We're not really sure how you manage to have those peers. You node seems to not have the `snap` protocol enabled (hence why it cannot sync the state), but there's no way to actually disable it AFAIK. Can you perhaps post your startup logs? Are you using stock Geth?
@onejmi Ok found it, please delete `SnapshotCache = 0` from your config. That disables snapshots and the snap protocol.
